Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Calmly \Calm"ly\, adv. In a calm manner. [1913 Webster]
The gentle stream which calmly flows. --Denham. [1913 Webster]
calmly adv 1: with self-possession (especially in times of stress); "he spoke calmly to the rioting students" 2: in a sedate manner [syn: {sedately}]
